story.iWant: to track learner progress through structured curriculum modules
story.soThat: conversations advance learning in a coherent sequence

context.applies: Domains with structured learning content (tutoring, training, onboarding)
assumptions: Curriculum is defined as a sequence of modules with prerequisites
Each module has concepts, skills, and mastery criteria
Progress can be non-linear but should respect prerequisites

acceptanceCriteria.title: Module Introduction Tracking
acceptanceCriteria.given: A new curriculum module is introduced in conversation
acceptanceCriteria.then: Module status moves from 'not_started' to 'introduced' with timestamp

acceptanceCriteria.title: Concept Exposure Measurement
acceptanceCriteria.given: Concepts from a module are discussed
acceptanceCriteria.then: Exposure count and depth are recorded per concept

acceptanceCriteria.title: Comprehension Assessment
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner demonstrates understanding of a concept
acceptanceCriteria.then: Comprehension score is recorded with evidence

acceptanceCriteria.title: Application Detection
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner applies a concept to a new situation

acceptanceCriteria.title: Module Mastery Determination
acceptanceCriteria.given: Learner has sufficient comprehension and application scores

acceptanceCriteria.title: Prerequisite Enforcement
acceptanceCriteria.then: Prerequisites must be at least 'competent' before full introduction

parameters.name: Module Introduction Status
parameters.description: Tracks whether and when a curriculum module was introduced to the learner

scoringAnchors.example: All 5 concepts in the 'Supply and Demand' module have been explained with examples
3 of 5 concepts covered, 2 remaining for next session
Module topic mentioned as preview for upcoming content
Module not yet mentioned in any conversation

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Module fully introduced - focus on comprehension and application activities.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Module not yet introduced - consider if prerequisites are met, then introduce core concepts.

parameters.name: Concept Exposure Depth
parameters.description: Measures how deeply a concept has been explored across conversations

scoringAnchors.example: Compound interest explained 3 times with different examples, learner has applied it to multiple scenarios
Concept explained once with 2 examples, learner asked clarifying questions
Concept defined in one sentence, one example given
Term mentioned in passing without explanation

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Concept well-exposed - ready for application and transfer activities.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Concept needs more exposure - provide additional examples and explanations.

parameters.name: Comprehension Score
parameters.description: Measures learner's demonstrated understanding of concepts

interpretationScale.label: Strong Comprehension
interpretationScale.implication: Can explain accurately in own words

scoringAnchors.example: Learner accurately explains concept using own words and creates novel example
Learner correctly answers comprehension probe and identifies key principles
Learner can repeat explanation but struggles with 'why' questions
Learner has partial understanding, confuses related concepts
Learner gives incorrect explanation with fundamental errors
Learner says 'I don't understand' or gives completely wrong answer

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Comprehension is strong - advance to application activities or next concept.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Comprehension is weak - revisit explanation with different approach, address misconceptions.

parameters.name: Application Score
parameters.description: Measures learner's ability to apply concepts to new situations

scoringAnchors.example: Learner independently identifies where concept applies and executes correctly in new context
Learner applies concept correctly when prompted to a new scenario
Learner attempts application but makes minor errors
Learner knows concept should apply but unsure how
Learner doesn't recognize opportunity to apply concept

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Application is strong - this concept is mastered, ready for advanced applications.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Application is weak - provide scaffolded practice with feedback before moving on.

parameters.name: Module Mastery Level
parameters.description: Overall mastery assessment combining comprehension and application

interpretationScale.label: Expert
interpretationScale.implication: Can teach others, handle edge cases

scoringAnchors.example: Learner demonstrates expert-level understanding, identifies edge cases, could teach concept
Learner consistently applies concept correctly without prompting
Learner understands and usually applies correctly, occasional errors
Learner has basic understanding but struggles with application
Learner just starting to grasp basic concepts

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Module mastered - can advance to dependent modules, use this concept as foundation.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Module not yet mastered - continue practice before introducing dependent content.

parameters.name: Prerequisite Readiness
parameters.description: Checks if prerequisites are met before advancing

scoringAnchors.example: All 3 prerequisite modules at 'competent' or higher
2 of 3 prerequisites met, third at 'novice'
1 of 3 prerequisites met
No prerequisites completed

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Prerequisites met - safe to introduce new module.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Prerequisites not met - focus on foundational concepts first.

parameters.name: Review Status Tracking
parameters.description: Tracks spaced retrieval schedule and review eligibility for curriculum units

fields.review_count: number of times unit has been reviewed
fields.next_review_due: call number when next review is due
fields.trend_delta: change in mastery since last review

interpretationScale.label: Review Current
interpretationScale.implication: Recently reviewed, mastery stable or improving

scoringAnchors.example: Unit reviewed 1 call ago, mastery stable at 0.8
Unit due for review in 2 calls, mastery stable
Unit was due for review 3 calls ago
Unit mastery dropped 0.2 since last review

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Review status is current - no urgent review needed.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Review is overdue or mastery declining - prioritize this unit for spaced retrieval.

constraints.description: Do not introduce modules until prerequisites reach 'competent' level
Limit introduction to 2-3 new concepts per session to avoid overload
Concepts with declining comprehension scores should be revisited
